body.p:
Lex. Ky. July 1st 1864
Gen. Leslie Combs

Dear sir, I inclose you herewith my resignation as Notary Public for Fayette County. I am very much obliged to you for having obtained it for me, but I have concluded that I cannot attend to its duties and I therefore resign it; and hereby recommend M. B. Jonson Esq of this city as a gentleman in every way suited to fill the place. Mr. Johnson is a Justice of the Peace, and has an office in this city. I hope that he will receive the appointment. Yours truly

Lexington, Kentucky, July 1st 1864
To His Excellency Gov Bramlette, Governor of Kentucky.
I hereby resign my office as Notary Publick for Fayette County Kentucky. I have not qualified under my appointment to the above named Office; and I hereby notify you that I decline doing so.

Accepted
C D Carr
W. D. Boswell

Fayette Co
Notary
M B Johnson
